result.execSummary:
The defendant Jerrel J Groce was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jerrel J Groce in court with attorney Danielle L. Shelton.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.    

As to Count 1:  Defendant ordered to serve 6 months in the House of Correction, straight time, with credit of 11 days time served, FORTHWITH. 
Court ordered dfendant to pay all costs and surcharges by 11-30-2015.  If unpaid a civil judgment will be ordered filed against the defendant.

Defendant Jerrel J Groce in court with attorney Danielle L. Shelton.  Katie Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Due to the volume of cases scheduled, Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 24.  Stipulated request for adjournment received and filed.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 30, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Jerrel J Groce in court with attorney Danielle L. Shelton.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 24.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 19, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Jerrel J Groce in court with attorney Michael Jude for Danielle L. Shelton.  James W. Frisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  JusticePoint Pretrial Services Violation Report received and filed.  ENTRY MADE WITHOUT COURT FILE.  Case called to address JusticePoint violation.  Arguments heard.  Court admonished the defendant.  Case remains calendared for sentencing hearing on August 6, 2015 at 1:30 pm in Branch 24.

Defendant Jerrel J Groce in court with attorney Danielle L. Shelton.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.

AS TO COUNT 2:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered count dismissed and read-in.

AS TO COUNT 1:  Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 24.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 6, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Jerrel J Groce in court with attorney Danielle L. Shelton.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Defense counsel has received discovery.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 24.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Jerrel J Groce in court with attorney Danielle L. Shelton.  James W. Frisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defense has not yet received all discovery.  Court orders state to turn over all discovery to defense by 04-15-2015.  Court orders case adjourned to Branch 24.  Status conference scheduled for April 29, 2015 at 10:00 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Jerrel J Groce in court with attorney Danielle L. Shelton.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Pretrial conference conducted. Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Jerrel J Groce in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Jerrel J Groce in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Protasiewicz, Branch 24.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
